alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 29 at 3:30PM MDT until September 29 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTY...SPECIFICALLY FOR NORTHERN PORTIONS OF CAPITOL REEF NATIONAL PARK... At 330 PM MDT, Capitol Reef National Park Rangers have reported 1-2 feet of water flowing into Grand Wash. The storm that produced this flash flooding has now intensified over Capitol Gorge. Flash flooding is already occurring in Grand Wash is expected to begin shortly in Capitol Gorge. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks, streams, normally dry washes and slot canyons. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park and Fruita. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
